faults.friendly_result: Your inputs were analyzed, and all classes are balanced in your training data.
faults.friendly_learn_more: Learn more about imbalanced data: https://aka.ms/AutomatedMLImbalancedData
faults.friendly_parameter_preface: Imbalanced data can lead to a falsely perceived positive effect of a model's accuracy because the input data has bias towards one class.

faults.friendly_result: If the missing values are expected, let the run complete. Otherwise cancel the current run and use a script to customize the handling of missing feature values that may be more appropriate based on the data type and business requirement.
faults.friendly_learn_more: Learn more about missing value imputation: https://aka.ms/AutomatedMLFeaturization

faults.friendly_result: The training data had the following high cardinality features which were excluded for training. Please review your data source and possibly filter out these columns. If you want to include these features for training, you can override column purpose with appropriate column type.
faults.friendly_learn_more: Learn more about high cardinality feature handling: https://aka.ms/AutomatedMLFeaturization
faults.friendly_parameter_preface: High cardinality features refer to columns that contain a large percentage of unique values.
